runs.comm: short of length and wide outside off, Perera cuts hard but gets a bottom edge back to the bowler
132 kph, swings this one into Perera from outside off, the batsman drives to cover
that's gone!! Full and wide outside off, Perera slashes at it and connects from the middle to send it all the way square of the wicket on off
short and wide this time and Perera cuts it off the back foot over over point for four this time. He's getting lots of room and is making full use of it
continues with a lot of room and this one's a wide outside off

chance for a run-out but he has made it. It was a back of a length ball coming in from outside off, Perera pushed it to cover and the fielder there took a bit of time to throw it to the keeper and by then Perera had come back after a mix-up. Dilshan hardly moved for a run
back of length outside off and Perera punches it between point and cover point for two to end the over
bowls into the pads and Dilshan tucks it on the leg side for one off his hips
around length outside off, driven to cover point by Perera
leading edge falls well short of cover. Tanvir angled this into the batsman who wanted to play it on the leg side but played a bit early
swings it into Perera again, who is crammed up for room, and is hit on the thigh pad as he tried to guide it on the leg side
length delivery just outside off, Perera pushes it to mid-on for one
good-length ball around off, Dilshan defends towards cover and goes off for the single straightaway. Just three from the over
starts with a wide down the leg side
length delivery from leg and Dilshan got into position early to scoop it over the short-fine leg fielder for a boundary
appeal for caught behind as Dilshan tries to scoop it again but misses and it goes just down the leg side, but not called a wide
139 kph, quicker and into the pads, Dilshan is beaten by pace as he tries to flick it to the leg side and says no for a leg bye
length delivery outside off, Dilshan pushes it to mid-off for one
fullish on the stumps, tucked to deep midwicket for one
good delivery on length around off and Dilshan times it sweetly to send it down the ground for a four with a mere push. Wasn't a powerful stroke, he used the pace of the ball
Perera pushes the length delivery outside off to cover
110 kph, much slower from the back of the hand outside off and Perera defends it to point
short and pulled straight to deep square leg, there's a fielder in place for that shot
length delivery outside off, edges this one to third man for one
136kph, back of length delivery rushes into the batsman who fails to get bat on ball trying to pull
full and wide, Perera drives it over the covers for a clean four. Felt like comparing that shot with that of a former SL opener
scoops it for four and how! It was well outside off, Dilshan had made up his mind to scoop it and adjusted to swivel his bat at the last moment to guide it over the keeper on the leg side
comes down the ground and launches this one for another four - on the off side. Slightly back of length delivery and Dilshan sent it over cover-point through the aerial route
comes down again but misses this time trying to smash it on the off side
137kph, short and outside off, he pierces the gap between point and third man for four. Didn't hit it too hard, just guided it and used the pace of the ball with a late cut
118kph, slower one but it's too short and Dilshan has enough time to smash it for another boundary - this time on the leg side with a pull
short again but it's pulled straight to midwicket. 16 from that over
fullish outside off, Perera comes down to drive it to long-on for one and that's SL's 50
turning in from length around off, flicks it to deep midwicket for one
slightly straighter on length close to off, pushed back to the bowler
on length outside off and turning away, pushed to cover this time
flatter and going down leg, tucked straight to backward square leg
outside off and Perera comes down to drive it to long-on. Just three from the over and that's the end of the Powerplay overs
tossed up outside off, cut to point where the fielder dives to save a run
flighted on middle and leg, on-driven towards midwicket for one
turning into Dilshan from outside off, he cuts it towards point for one
flighted outside off and Perera cuts it off the back foot to deep point
big shout for lbw as this was on length and turning towards the stumps and caught Dilshan on the back foot, it was very very close. Might have been hitting leg stump but the umpire didn't think so
on length on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
full outside off, driven down to long-off for one
99kph, full on off, Dilshan tried to thrash it towards cover but got an edge on the leg side
back of length and outside off, cut off the back foot to third man
googly and quicker one coming in, Dilshan got bat on it just in time off the back foot while cutting it
well outside off, Dilshan cuts again without much footwork and gets a bottom edge between the keeper's legs for four
fuller on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket for one
full and flighted on the stumps, driven down to long-on
on length just outside off, Perera opens the face of the bat to guide it to short third man
shorter and flatter, Dilshan goes back and punches it to deep midwicket
going straight from around off on length, tucked between deep midwicket and long-on and a fumble gives SL an extra run
length delivery on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
full toss down leg and Dilshan goes down on a knee to sweep it to the fine-leg boundary. Nobody in the deep there
full and outside off, punched down to long-off
falls just short of Afridi, it was pitched outside off and Dilshan chipped it back as it fell short and they take a single as Afridi doesn't collect it
Perera makes room and gets a thick edge as it goes over short third man for four
goes down the pitch and slogs this full delivery on middle and leg between deep midwicket and deep fine leg for four more. He didn't quite middle that one either
but this one's from the meat of the bat! Came down the track and thrashed the ball from outside off to the wide long on boundary for maximum
on the pads, tucked to deep square leg for one and keeps strike. 17 runs from Afridi's second over
slightly short outside off, pulled for a single
flatter on middle and leg, Dilshan goes back to clip it to deep fine leg
back of length close to off, pushed towards long-on and they take two
flighted and full on off, comes down and pushes it to long-on
flatter one on leg, Dilshan sweeps and gets a top edge over short fine leg for two more
length ball on middle, turns it with the wrists to midwicket
turns in sharply and it's flatter as they appeal for lbw, but it was going down leg
outside off and turning in, pushed back to Ajmal
turning in from length outside off, Dilshan defends it towards point for one
comes down the track but this one's slower and hits him on the pads
full on the stumps and chipped towards long-on for one, that's his third T20 fifty
Ajmal has done it, he's broken the stand! Dilshan reverse slapped this full delivery on middle stump straight into the hands of sweeper cover. He's gone for 48
turning into the batsman from off, hits the batsman on the pads
slightly back of length and he's pulled it just past deep fine leg
full and down leg, goes for a wide and a boundary
another wide down leg and they take a bye too
back of length on middle, tucked to deep midwicket for one
that's gone all the way! It was pitched on leg and Prasanna slogged it over the backward square leg boundary for a biggie!
six more! Prasanna's on fire here. This one pitched well outside off and the debutant launched it straight down the ground. Sohaib Maqsood at long-on tried but it went well over him
angled it into the pads, Prasanna can't connect it this time
takes a step down and drives it down to long-on
well outside off, Prasanna tried to slog but got an edge to short third man
going towards middle stump from length, chipped towards midwicket for one
quicker one down the leg side for a wide
turning into the batsman from outside off, Prasanna tries another slog and gets a bottom edge fine past the keeper on the off side
wide down the leg side again
Ajmal strikes again! Fullish delivery outside off, Prasanna goes for a slog and gets a leading edge to be taken at point
length delivery outside off, comes down and defends
full and outside off, Sanga drives it behind square on the off side
109 kph, slower ball on the leg side, Sanga made room and pulled it over the midwicket boundary for four from the middle of the bat
129 kph, bouncer down the leg side for a wide. First of the over
very high full toss on the off side and Sanga shuffles across towards the ball to scoop it over the keeper for a four. That's a no ball for the height
low full toss well outside off, just inside the line for a wide
full on the pads and Sanga takes his right leg out of the way to drive it firmly to deep midwicket
full on the stumps and Perera smashes it down the ground through the bowler's legs and Umar Amin dives full length to his right at long-on to save two runs
short ball on leg and Perera pulls it to short fine leg, scampers his way to complete the single
length delivery outside off, Sanga turns it to deep midwicket with his wrists
full on off, chipped down the ground to long on for two. The bowler and keeper are furious because of the inaccurate throw which gave SL the extra run
low full toss on leg, tucked to deep midwicket for one
flighted and well outside off, driven straight to cover
full and around off, clipped to the leg side for one
Sanga gets going now! Ajmal pitched it up outside leg as Sanga made room and thrashed it straight down the ground for a six
and what does he start with? A four. Pitched it full and outside off, Perera couldn't get middle of the bat but the thick outside edge beat third man for four
angles this one into the pads, Perera can't get bat on it but they run a leg bye
full toss outside off and Sanga doesn't thrash it, he only shuffles across and scoops it fine on the leg side for four
back of length outside off, Sanga pulled and missed
another full toss outside off and Sanga drives it to cover for one
back of length outside off, Perera slaps it down the ground to long-on
short ball around off and Perera pulls it to deep backward square leg for two
fuller outside off and a thick bottom edge goes to mid-off
full around off and Sanga launches it over mid-off towards the boundary for two
slower yorker on the stumps and Sanga drives it down the ground for two more
short ball on leg, Sanga tries to scoop it over short fine leg but can't connect
almost a yorker on off, driven down the ground firmly by Sanga for two to end the over
full and outside off, chipped over mid-off for two by Perera
full again outside off, punched down the ground to long-on for one
attempted yorker is a low full toss outside off, steered to point for a single
oh what a shot! Usman pitched it up outside off, Perera moved across and swivelled his bat with the wrists to send it for six over the fine leg boundary
six more - this time straight down the ground! Slightly slower and short of length outside off, launched back over the bowler's head
attempted yorker outside off, driven firmly through the covers for two
slower delivery is short and going away but Sanga slaps it straight down the ground into the sight screen for a maximum
short of length again, Sanga moves across and scoops it from outside off over short fine leg for four. He's raced to 42 form 18
full and outside off, tries a slog and misses
length ball angling away, Sanga slashes and gets a bottom edge to short third man
106 kph, slower one pitches on leg and angling away, bottom edge towards point gets another single
full toss outside off sent down the ground to long-off and they are coming back for the second. An accurate throw from the fielder and Tanvir whips the bails off to run Perera out
